result.execSummary:
The defendant Lukas J. SCHROEDER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Defendant is to continue his mental health treatment.

Defendant is to take all medications as prescribed and in the prescribed doses.
 
Provide DNA sample and pay the sucharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys.
It is hereby ordered that the law firm of Sczygelski Law Firm, LLC be and hereby is substituted as attorneys of record for the defendant in place on Attorney Jewel Scharenbroch.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-10-14 at 2:00 p.m.  Plea date is set for 01-07-15 at 9:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 09-11-14 at 9:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts theft of credit card, 4 counts theft, 4 counts forgery, 1 count attempted theft, 9 counts theft by fraudulent use of credit card, possess THC and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-08-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the conditions that he maintain absolute sobriety and that he have no contact with Maria Hamill, Sharon Schroeder, Gerald McGill and Trevor Chapleski-Garrison. (This is the total cash bail on 14 CF 374, 14 CF 375 and 14 CM 465).  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
